main event: A series of UFO sightings were reported in Dairy, Oregon on various dates, with descriptions of silver-colored, 40-ft diameter objects hovering motionless and emitting sounds similar to a generator. Some witnesses reported conflicting testimony about the altitude and speed of the objects.
interesting points: The sightings detailed observations of 40-ft diameter, silver-colored objects with tapered top and bottom, emitting sounds similar to a generator and hovering motionless.
Witnesses reported conflicting testimony about the altitude and speed of the objects, with some describing speeds similar to that of a normal commercial plane.
The observations were made using binoculars and high-power glasses, with no photographs present in the report.
One report noted a slow movement of the object, while another described a rapid rate of speed and a climbing turn at a 30-degree angle.
The report mentioned a heavy surface inversion and the impossibility of a balloon due to wind direction, suggesting an occurrence beyond ordinary atmospheric conditions.
sighted object: silver-colored, 40-ft diameter objects emitting sounds similar to a generator
witnesses: various visual observers with differing testimonies
photographs: no photographs included in the report
